core

Class FileSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractListModel<E>
      • javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String>
        • core.FileSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.ListModel<java.lang.String>

    public class FileSet
extends javax.swing.DefaultListModel<java.lang.String>

    Contains a complete specification for a backup operation. The FileSet describes the settings for a backup operation and includes a collection of source paths to back up, a name for the backup (both the FileSet object itself as well as the name of the root directory in the file system that the backup will process into), and a destination path to copy the source files into.

    When the backup operation finishes, the complete path heirarchy for the source files will be replicated inside the destination directory. In other words, if the source path for a file is /home/someuser/mytest and the destination is set to /home/someuser/backup and the name of the FileSet is 2015-12-10, then the mytest file will be found at /home/someuser/backup/2015-12-10/home/someuser/mytest.

    The destination path, FileSet name, and all sources must be valid paths in the file system and must be absolute references.

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Greg Palen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • destination

        private java.lang.String destination
        The full path to the destination directory to copy the source files into.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name

        The name of this FileSet object. Also becomes the name of the directory that is created to store the backup into.

        This name is appended to the destination above to form the full Path to the backup directory.

        private static final long serialVersionUID

        The total number of bytes to be copied as reported by the file system.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSet

        public FileSet()
        Standard no-arg constructor. Use to instantiate a FileSet when you do not know what the name of the FileSet should be and you do not know the destination path.
        See Also:
        setName(String), setDestination(String)

      • FileSet

        public FileSet(java.lang.String name)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Convenience onstructor used to create a new FileSet and set the name of the FileSet at the same time. Use this constructor when you know what name you want to give to the FileSet.
        Parameters:
        name - String representing the name to give to the FileSet. This name must conform to the file naming rules of the host file system/platform.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the name is not a valid file name on the underlying host file system.

      • FileSet

        public FileSet(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String destination)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Convenience constructor that creates a new FileSet with the destination path specified. The destination must be an absolute reference, must be valid on the underlying file system/platform, and must be writeable.
        Parameters:
        destination - String representing the full path to the destination for the backup operation. This should be a folder path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the path provided is contains illegal characters for the underlying file system or the directory is unwritable (usually due to bad permissions).
        java.lang.Exception

      • read

        public static FileSet read(java.lang.String fullPathToFile)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Factory method that instantiates a FileSet by reading the contents of a file on disk from the path specified and constructs a FileSet object from the contents of the file
        Parameters:
        fullPathToFile - String representing the absolute path to a file containing a saved FileSet.
        Returns:
        FileSet A new FileSet instantiated with the values read in from disk.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the file specified does not represent a FileSet object or is otherwise unreadable (doesn't exist, insufficient permissions, etc.).

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(java.lang.String path)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the specified path from the list of sources that the FileSet is going to copy. Nothing happens if the supplied path does not exist in the current FileSet list of sources.
        Parameters:
        path - A string representing an absolute path to a file to be backed up as part of the copy operation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the specified path does not exist or is not readable (usually due to permissions).

      • save

        public static void save(java.lang.String fullPathToFile,
                        FileSet fileSet)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Saves a FileSet to a directory. The file will have the name contained in name and will be stored in the path provided in the absolutePath parameter.
        Parameters:
        fullPathToFile - A string representing the absolute path for where to create and save the FileSet. This should be a FILE path and NOT a directory. The name of the saved FileSet will be the right-most element in the filePath parameter. If a file with this complete path already exists, it will be overwritten with the contents of the FileSet passed in via this parameter.
        fileSet - The FileSet object to save to disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw an IOException if the destination cannot be written to or a write error occurs.

      • setDestination

        public void setDestination(java.lang.String destination)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the destination directory the backup will get created in. This represents the absolute Path to a directory that will contain the backup.
        Parameters:
        destination - String representing the absolute path to a directory to write the backup into.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the directory contains illegal characters for the underlying file system/platform or if the specified destination cannot be written into (due to permissions typically).

      • validExistingPath

        public static boolean validExistingPath(java.lang.String path)
        Utility method to determine if a given path is valid. To be valid, the path must:
        Parameters:
        path - String representing the absolute Path to validate.
        Returns:
        Boolean True if the path is valid and the File specified by the last element of the path string exists.

      • validFileName

        public static boolean validFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Validates that a given fileName represents a legal name for a file on the underlying host file system/platform.
        Parameters:
        fileName - String representing ONLY the file name to test (NOT an absolute path - just the name itself)
        Returns:
        Boolean True if the fileName is valid.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when a file with that name is invalid. This is tested by attempting to create a file with that name in a temporary folder. Could return the exception if JVM is unable to create the temp directory.
